intro: Amsinckia insularis, commonly known as the Santa Catalina Island poppy, is a flowering plant native to the Channel Islands of California. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has hairy, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Amsinckia insularis is rare and endangered, with limited distribution, making it a subject of conservation interest.
